intro: Jatropha conzattii, commonly known as the Mexican physic nut, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and spiny, lobed leaves. The plant produces toxic seeds that contain a milky latex, which can be harmful if ingested. Jatropha conzattii is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments.
